name: St. Peter Claver

locations.description: Jesuit missionary to enslaved Africans in Cartagena

summary: Peter Claver was a Spanish Jesuit priest who dedicated his life to serving enslaved Africans in Cartagena, Colombia. He met slave ships as they arrived, bringing food, medicine, and comfort to the newly arrived captives. He baptized over 300,000 enslaved people and worked tirelessly to improve their conditions. He is the patron saint of slaves, African missions, and interracial justice.
keyQuotes: We must speak to them with our hands before we speak to them with our lips.
